channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2024050727
item.description:
Report E-2024050727

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/30/2024, while loading a trailer, at Veolia's facility in Henderson, CO, a 55 gallon drum of UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids, n.o.s, (Acetonitrile, Acetone) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 10 gallons of liquid to the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. No employee exposures were reported and cleanup was conducted by trained Veolia personnel. The drum was overpacked prior to being placed in transportation.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/22/2024 while unloading a trailer at Veolia's facility in Henderson, CO, a 55 gallon drum of UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids, n.o.s, (Styrene, Benzene) was discovered to be leaking from bottom of drum. The hole was pinhole size and approximately Â½ gallon impacted the trailer floor. Remediation of the spill was conducted by trained Veolia personnel.

item.title: Report X-2024051254
item.description:
Report X-2024051254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/19/2024 at approximately 1845, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 906768 at the ramp facilty in Denver, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods commodity. The shipment consisted of one sealed lead acid battery, packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered showing evidence of spillage. The acid spilled from the battery, however the cause of the spillage is unknown. One employee was reported burned from the acid spillage and was treated with first aid. It does not appear that the commodity was properly identified nor declared as a sealed lead acid battery. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024050619
item.description:
Report E-2024050619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Estes
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâs arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 15ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 6ft-by-2ft area of the gravel lot and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a puncture damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were recovered and placed along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and two (2) 30-gallon poly drums. One additional 30-gallon poly drum containing impacted PPE and a broken-down pallet and one (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing the damaged drum were generated. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
